Articles.Content: Just purchased KSP and recieved a purchase confirmation email but no D/L link and cant find one anywhere on their site...am i missing something here?
Where did you buy the game - the official KSP store, or from Steam?
Welcome!  Go to My Account - Download

Hello Motiontracker and welcome to the forum!

As CliftonM mentioned above, if you purchased directly from the KSP store, you just log into the store and go to My Account and then click Downloads.

You should have several downloads to choose from depending on your O.S.

Happy landings!

Hi,

Got the same problem. I bought the game on the store, and the download link does not appear. According to the FAQ i Emailed support but still no link. I Hope they move, i can't wait going into space ! (i actually do but ...)
I am having the same issue too. It's not that I don't know where to go, it's that I have an order no. via email but it is not showing up in the store. Any way to go around it?

Hi @Motiontracker, @Riton Lafouine, @Waiting to Fly and @MrAA!

Really sorry to hear you're having problems. It can happen from time to time when a new update is released and overloads their servers. If you haven't already done so, the best thing is to send an email to [email protected] (if you bought the game from the KSP website). If you bought the game from Steam or another web site, I'll have to let someone else answer you because I have never used those.

Again, I'm sorry to hear you're having trouble getting your download. But it will be worth the wait! (And there is usually a patch a few days after the release of a big update, anyway, so maybe it's not such a bad thing to wait a day or two).

Edited April 22, 2016 by Deddly

It took over 24 hours but i did get a reply from KSP support and my download was finally available on the Kerbal site., Installed but now there is no parts to select on the left hand side to start anything in career mode...

Edited April 22, 2016 by Motiontracker

2 hours ago, Motiontracker said:

there is no parts to select on the left hand side to start anything in career mode...

Glad it finally worked out for you. So are there no parts at all or do you mean there are only a few parts? In career mode, you only start with a few basic parts and you have to do research to get more. If you want to try out everything, there's sandbox mode, which will give you access to all the parts.
Thanks @Deddly Nothing yet but hopefully it will be through tomorrow.
